titlepage.titleproper: Preliminary Inventory to the Theodore Draper Papers, 1912-1966
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1998 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Correspondence, clippings, pamphlets, newspaper issues, and congressional hearings, relating to the revolution led by Fidel Castro in Cuba, political, social, and economic conditions in Cuba, the 1965 crisis and American intervention in the Dominican Republic, and the Communist Party of the United States.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Theodore Draper Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

controlaccess.head: Access Points
controlaccess.corpname: Communist Party of the United States of America
controlaccess.subject: Communism
Communism--United States

did.unittitle: Cuba. Inventory of the collection of material on Fidel Castro's struggle for power in Cuba and the political, economic and social changes following his take-over, 1948-1966
FORDC (Frente Obrero Revolucionario Democrático de Cuba)
Originals of "Pasajes de la Guerra Revolutionaria"
PURS (Partido Unido de la Revoluciòn Socialista)
Twenty-sixth of July Movement in Exile
Dominican Republic. Inventory of the collection of material on the Dominican Republic crises with emphasis on United State involvement, 1963-1966
Partido Socialista Popular (PSP) and Partido Comunista Dominicano (PDC)
United States Senate hearings on DR
United States Senate hearings on the DR
Communist Party. Inventory of the collection of material pertaining mostly to the Communist Party in America (some socialist material included), 1912-1958
Russian propaganda. Hearing before a subcommittee of the committee on foreign relations United States Senate, 1920
Session of American Commission on 1924 May 6. Darcy
Workers Party of America. Minutes of first convention 1921 December. Mimeograph
Zimmerman material. Zack letter 1927 July 29 to ECCI. Photostat
Wicks material. Articles from the Proletarian, 1921-22
Thesis on the Present Economic and Political Situation and the Policy of the Workers Party submitted by John Pepper and C. E. Ruthenberg, 1923 November thesis (Wicks material, original, mimeograph)
Thesis on Our Labor Party Policy, 1923 August 24 (Wicks material, original, mimeograph)
Correspondence to W. J. Ghent, Philip Klarnet, etc.
Miscellaneous printed, photostated material pertaining to communism
Odd sheets; index of TUC minutes, 1925-1928. Louis Nemzer, Coolidge regarding La Follette, etc.
Minutes. Political Committee, 1928 January-June. Photocopies, including Secretariat 1928 January 16
Minutes. Resolution on Trade Union Work (by Foster), 1928 May 30. Photocopy
Wicks' letter to Engdahl, 1929 May 9. Report by Lovestone Delegation in Moscow. Original
Minutes. Trade Union Committee - C.E.C., 1925-26. Photocopies
Minutes. Political Committee, 1928 November. Call to Sixth Convention 1928 November 28
Traditional Right Wing in the American Party and Our Fight Against It
Katterfeld, L. E. Taped interview by Theodore Draper, 1956 September 8. Typed
Meeting of executive bureau (RILU), 1928 January 3. Report of Comrade Browder on American question (Trade Union). Photocopy
Correspondence with Ted Draper, 1954 December-1955 January. Originals and typed duplicates
Wicks' statement to the Comintern "Observations on the factional situation in the American Party," Moscow, 1929 April 15. Original
"History of the Communist Movement in America" by Alexander Bittelman, 1923-24. (Special Comm. to investigate Comm. activities, 1930). Photocopy
Cannon-Draper correspondence put on film 1958 July
Negro. Otto Hall and Harry Haywood
Kahanovitch, L. M. Organizational structure of the Russian Communist Party, probably 1925. Mimeograph
Ruthenberg to Comintern. Letter dated 1924 April 11 (Browder material)
Sandburg, Carl. Correspondence with T.D. and photostat of C.S. statement in Stockholm, correspondence dated 1956 February 25
Wicks' speech on Comintern Moscow, 1929 April 21. Lovestone delegation at American Commission (Wicks material, original)
Minutes. Political Committee Secretariat, 1927 November-December. Photocopies
Minutes. Secretariat, Political Committee, 1927 October. Photocopies
Minutes. Central Executive Committee, Secretariat Political Committee, 1927 September. Photocopies, index to minutes, 1927 September-December
Lovestone's letter to the comintern on behalf of Pepper, 1924. (Browder material, copied by Browder from original)
Appeal to comintern on behalf of Pepper by Robert Minor, 1924. (Wicks material, original)
T.U.U.L.-T.U.E.L., 1922-1930. Contents of file of documents dealing with T.U.U.L.-T.U.E.L.
Minutes. Trade Union Committee - C.E.C., 1927. Photocopies
Minutes. Gitlow exhibits (typed) copies. Executive Council, Secretariat, Politbureau, Political committee, etc., 1924, 1924, 1926
May Day of Revolution (leaflet) United Communist Party of America, 1920? (Wicks material, original)
Minutes. Central Executive Committee Communist Party of America, 1919 November 15-17, 18 (Wicks material, original, mimeograph)
Minutes. Central Executive Committee Communist Party of America, 1919 November 15-18. Photocopies
Theodore Draper's notes and research covering the years ca. 1912-1953 in preparation for his writing about communism and the Communist Party in America
Newspaper clippings and excerpts from Communist Party literature ca. 1923-1929. Copies. 4 notebooks
12 pamphlets mostly issued by United States Communist Party, 1896-1956
Final manuscript of American Communism and Soviet Russia, by Theodore Draper
